adjectives.description: placoderm (comparative more placoderm, superlative most placoderm)

entries.meaning: (paleontology) Pertaining to the class Placodermi. [from 19th c.]
examples: Research published recently on placoderm fish fossils from Scottish Devonian lakes (around 365 myo) found evidence for how this extinct group of animals copulated.

entries.meaning: (paleontology) A member of an extinct class (Placodermi) of jawed fish with armored heads and thoraces; the group lived during the Silurian and Devonian periods. [from 19th c.]
